article.headline: Santa Clara 75, Pepperdine 68
article.story: SANTA CLARA, Calif. (AP) -- Doron Perkins scored all of his 17 points in the second half and Santa Clara beat Pepperdine 75-68 on Thursday night. Perkins, a 6-foot-2 junior, scored nine of Santa Clara's last 10 points -- seven from the free throw line -- as the Broncos (10-7, 2-0 West Coast Conference) held off the Waves (6-12, 1-2). Santa Clara held a 55-52 lead with just under 10 minutes remaining, but the Broncos outscored the Waves 8-1 to take a 63-53 lead with 5:15 left. Guard Kyle Bailey scored six points for Santa Clara in that stretch. Pepperdine closed within 66-63 on two free throws by Glen McGowan with 1:50 remaining, but a reverse layup by Perkins on an assist from Bailey gave Santa Clara a five-point lead. Perkins then made two free throws with 53 seconds left for a 70-63 lead. Bailey scored 13 points for Santa Clara, while Travis Niesen added 12. McGowan and Yakhouba Diawara each had 16 points for Pepperdine.
